I believe the management had United Health Care. It was kind of annoying, most people had to take on second jobs, then they hired a bunch of new people to have more part time employees instead of a select full time. It was nice to have shifts covered, but it was also annoying because there were always new people that didn't know what they were doing."]

Description: [" Health insurance isn't the best, but they do offer it as an option that comes out of your bi-weekly check. Only managers get paid vacations."]

Employee: Current  Kitchen Manager  in Virginia Beach, Virginia
Description: [' Expensive health insurance, no 401k']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Las Vegas, Nevada
Description: [" It's not the best company for benefits."]

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Hartford, Connecticut
Description: [' 401k was okay, but the benefits were expensive and inadequate.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Snellville, Georgia
Description: [' No benefits offered to part time employees']

Employee: Current  Assistant General Manager  in Columbus, Ohio
Description: [' Bonus dropped with new company. Rmh franchise']

Employee: Former  Hostess  in Westbury, New York State
Description: [' there is none really, if there is it stinks.']

Employee: Current  Restaurant Manager  in Spokane, Washington State
Description: [' health insurance ,401k,vacation,paid leave,bonus performance']

Employee: Former  Area Director  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [' Health Care is a great advantage']

Employee: Former  General manager   in El Paso, Texas
Description: [' We we hosted in Las Vegas for our annual performance rewards!']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Martinsville, Illinois
Description: [' The benefit package does not come into effect until you have worked there for a year. So until then you will just be working and working with no incentives but the tips and checks you make']

Employee: Current  Server  in Sunrise, Florida
Description: [" The only benefit you get here is that it's part time so scheduling is flexible. But they sometimes schedule you against the days you are available and won't help getting it covered."]

Employee: Former  server  in Countryside, Illinois
Description: [" there wasn't one. not offered or not communicated to non-full time employees"]

Employee: Current  Employee  in El Paso, Texas
Description: [' The worst thing about Applebees is that they give you no days off. You will work overtime and only get paid $4 an hour.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Kansas City, Missouri
Description: [' They offer good insurance coverage, but I guess like everywhere else, it is getting more and more expensive']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Ocala, Florida
Description: [" There is no benefits package. You can't get PTO unless your full time. Even then Full Time is very difficult to get."]

Employee: Former  Server   in San Rafael, California
Description: [' Nothing at all unless you slave away to become a manager, which is basically throwing your life away...']

Employee: Former  Assistant Manager  in Raleigh, North Carolina
Description: [' Benefits are above average for the industry']

Employee: Former  Hostess  in Kansas City, Kansas
Description: [' they had very flexible schedules so i was able to juggle between work and school. tips were also good']

Employee: Current  Server  in Gold River, California
Description: [" No one can afford health care. I'm sorry, we just can't. I do love the in-company fund. That's going to help a lot of people."]

Employee: Former  Server/Bartender  in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
Description: [' They hire you as Part Time but you will be working 5-6 days a week with Full Time hours 40+ a week, No Benefits, you get 50% off meals ONLY when working, should be whenever you visit. Some stores give 50% off whatever you order, others cap you at 50% off but no more than $6.00 can be discounted. So a $8.00 meal is $4.00 a $12.00 meal is $6.00 but a $15.00 meal is $9.00 they only take off $6.00 but just down the street the other stores would give there staff that same meal for $7.50. Depending on your person ringing your food up they might even charge you for a soda when its usually free.']

Employee: Former  Food Server  in Douglasville, Georgia
Description: [' Absolutely none at this type of company.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Alexandria, Louisiana
Description: [" I wasn't offered a benefit package."]

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Kendallville, Indiana
Description: [' The insurance was a joke. There was no prescription plan. I had to leave because of the insurance being so bad. Things had to have changed since Obama care started.']

Employee: Former  Line cook  in Newark, Delaware
Description: [" Nothing is offered to part time workers, which is half of the restaurant. No Union or anything. You don't even get time and a half on holidays. Only free meals"]

Employee: Former  Hostess  in Laurel, Mississippi
Description: [' I did not stay long enough to receive a benefits package, nor did I desire to have one. However, I heard from other employees that the dental part was insufficient.']

Employee: Former  Cook  in Dothan, Alabama
Description: [' I had dental and medical Great 401k']

Employee: Current  Regional Human Resources Manager  in New Orleans, Louisiana
Description: [' Love the 401K option and matching and our insurance is great & Maternity Leave.']

Employee: Former  Trainer  in Kansas City, Kansas
Description: [' 401k for hourly employees plus the ability to earn PTO. Hard to find in the restaurant industry.']

Employee: Current  Assistant Manager  in Macon, Georgia
Description: [" Working for Applebee's come with some good perk. 2 week paid vacation, health, dental, and vision package. you also get match 401K"]

Employee: Former  General Manager  in Memphis, Tennessee
Description: [' Premiums increased every year for health insurence']

Employee: Former  Line Cook  in Vincennes, Indiana
Description: [' When the restaurant I worked at was still corporate they offered 401k and paid vacation. 6 months after I started a franchise bought out that restaurant and did away with all benefits for non-management positions, except for employee discount.']

Employee: Current  Host  in Ann Arbor, Michigan
Description: [' As a host you get tip share from the servers which usually averages out to around $9/hr']

Employee: Current  Gm  in Charleston, West Virginia
Description: [' 401k has a once per year company contribution if you have at least 6. % sched contribution in your end']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Nashville, Tennessee
Description: [' No 401k and fair health insurance.']

Employee: Former  Restaurant Manager  in Hampton, Virginia
Description: [' The Benefits are about average for salary associates. The bonus program was non existent for most everyone. I heard some managers complaining about prescriptions not covered. 401k plan was 2% match']

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Fairfax, Virginia
Description: [" As an hourly employee I have very little in the way of a benefits package. I work 40+ hours a week for more than three years but have accrued 0 hours of paid vacation, I have the ability to buy into a health insurance program which doesn't cover any basics (only covers one check up per year...making it cheaper to use urgent care centers), and we have no raises available to us. Salaried positions have better options, however."]

Employee: Current  Server/Bartender  in Gold River, California
Description: [' having health coverage, also being able to qualify for such an amazing program that I would get through being an applebees crew member']

Employee: Current  Assistant Manager  in Las Vegas, Nevada
Description: [' Vacation is good. Start off with 2 weeks paid and can eventually move up to 3 or 4 weeks. 401k program is also good. Insurance was pretty good until this year. Now it is not good at all.']

Employee: Current  Expeditor  in Atlanta, Georgia
Description: [' No real benefits for part-time workers. Food discounts based on work, 50% up to $5.00 for a shift, or 100% up to $10.00 for a double. Still a pretty good environment.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Woodstock, Georgia
Description: [' The worst thing is you do not get any benefits.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Elk Grove, California
Description: [" The benefits package as working as a part-time employee at Applebee's included the free meals during training and the discount on meals during the post training period."]

Employee: Current  Server  in Farmingville, New York State
Description: [' Very good benefits, hard to hit the necessary hours with many overtime restrictions.']

Employee: Current  Server  in Wichita, Kansas
Description: [' THe people are great the pay so so.']

Employee: Former  Employee  in Toms River, New Jersey
Description: [" Very expensive, little coverage. Didn't need it though."]

Employee: Former  Manager  in Kansas City, Missouri
Description: [' It was average for a company.']

Employee: Former  waiter  in Orange, Connecticut
Description: [' Look for long term employees and upgrade your benefits.']

Employee: Former  General Manager  in Orlando, Florida
Description: [' Good benefit package overall for managers']

Employee: Former  bartendar/server  in Milwaukee, Wisconsin
Description: [" There isn't really a benefits package. They offered the insurance where you pay upfront and then the company pays you back a part of the total amount. (I currently forget the name of the insurance company, i think it was the one with the duck)."]

Employee: Former  Server  in Kansas City, Kansas
Description: [' Benefits are pretty standard for the service industry']

Employee: Former  Assistant Manager  in Atlanta, Georgia
Description: [' I got 4 weeks paid vacation. New managers hired after 2013 only get 2 weeks. Health insurance for self plus one was $600 out of pocket per month and coverage was very poor. This was a $4k deductible plan with $200/ month hsa contribution. This was their bottom tier plan and was the cheapest option even with the hsa contribution. Worst coverage ive seen for a professional career.']

Employee: Former  Server  in Sayreville, New Jersey
Description: [" Not comprehensive for today's needs"]

Employee: Former  Employee  in Dallas, Texas
Description: [" Franchisee didn't offer any 401k"]

Employee: Current  Server At Applebees  in Rosemount, Minnesota
Description: [' Health insurance is offered, but you must be willing to pay for it out of pocket.']

Employee: Former  Bartender  in Birch Run, Michigan
Description: [' They dont provide anything, but its not a skilled trade job so, I didnt really expect them to.']

Employee: Current  Employee  in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Employee: Current  Carside to Go  in Lexington-Fayette, Kentucky

Employee: Current  Server  in Kansas City, Kansas
Description: [' The best thing is that consumers likes the hard work of the worker.']
